intro: Stoebe elgonensis, commonly known as Elgon betony, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of East Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a glandular surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Stoebe elgonensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine by local communities.
